entry.title: reasons why
entry.summary:
Author: mikaminato

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 9,314Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 11

Summary: "I'm a difficult person to love, Clark," Bruce says quietly, turning away from him to stare at some indistinct point across the cave. He's building a wall with that single sentence. Clark can feel it rise between them, made of stone and old grief. "I don't recommend it." He makes a small, humorless sound, as if that entire statement were some kind of punchline he's only just now understanding. "Who asked for a recommendation?" Clark's reply comes out sharper than he intended, raw and a little too honest. "I'm a big boy, Bruce. I can make my own decisions." ¬† (Or, as it turns out, Clark's feelings aren't as unrequited as he previously believed.)

entry.title: so beautiful inside. (don‚Äôt you know, it‚Äôs torturous?)
entry.summary:
Author: Phenomamal

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,255Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 12

Summary: Batman and Superman form an uneasy alliance, working together to defend their sister cities from Gotham‚Äôs and Metropolis‚Äôs criminal underworlds. That fragile balance shatters when Lex Luthor creates a clone using his and Superman‚Äôs DNA, gaining access to the Fortress of Solitude and revealing footage of Superman‚Äôs parents‚Äô true intentions to the world, twisting public perception and striking at the heart of the heroes‚Äô partnership. The fallout is immediate. Bruce‚Äôs guarded distrust snaps back into place, sharper than ever, while Clark is fully aware of how damning the revelations appear, is deeply hurt that the trust he fought so hard to earn could be dismantled so easily, and by Luthor of all people. Batman still has too many unanswered questions, and he intends to uncover the truth by any means necessary. Cue the stalking. Clark only wishes he would just ask.

entry.title: Spiders and Bats Come From the Dark
entry.summary:
Author: Zoveezz

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,826Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 6

Summary: Two years after being erased by the spell, twenty-one-year-old Peter Parker is pulled out of nowhere into another universe, Gotham. Now he has to find a way back to his own, no matter the cost. After a while, he thinks that maybe with the help of these bats he can get back home. ¬øWhy does he keep feeling like he's already there? ¬øAnd why does Jason keep showing up at his mechanic job on his broken motorcycle? (I'm going to do this work in Spanish too, a couple of hours difference between the upload of the same chapter in another work) ------- At twenty, Jason became Red Hood; now, at twenty-two, he still is. He no longer gets along badly with his stupid vigilante family, but he's not comfortable neither. Maybe because that feeling of loneliness, of isolation, is always there, with the rage. He's stressed out with a difficult case when he meets Peter, whom, for some reason, Jason can't stop staring at. And then there was that idiot Spider-Man who was hanging around in his neighborhood.

entry.title: And Now It Follows Me Everyday
entry.summary:
Author: theFamousLivingDead

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 28,892Chapters: 9/?Kudos: 46

Summary: Gotham has a reputation that precedes itself, but these days even her city limits are overrun with chaos. The streets are littered with rumors about a new shape above the skyline. The docks have been taken over by gangs and civilians are forced to keep to a curfew for their own safety. Bruce Wayne is stumped when all his attempts to prevent crime from taking off in Gotham are thwarted by a lightningfast shadow. His worst nightmare comes true -- there is someone else out there, more powerful than he could ever train himself to be, and he's not on his side of history. entry.title: The Icarus to Your Certainty
entry.summary:
Author: roaringly

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,610Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 11

Summary: That night, Bruce prayed quietly in his own head, staring blankly at the gray wall his bed was tucked against. He felt warm, wet tears fall from his eyes and soaking the pillow beneath him. Alfred sat sleeping in the rocking chair next to him, his hand draped weakly over Bruce‚Äôs back in comfort. Can you hear me, God? Please, answer. He was only met with a deafening silence in return, with accents like the buzz of the ceiling fan and the gentle sound of Alfred‚Äôs breathing piercing through it, and Bruce never prayed again after that. He saw no need to. God wasn‚Äôt real. Gods weren‚Äôt real. At least that‚Äôs what he thought until Clark entered his life.
